cons: The only Con Is there were some opportunities to mingle with other students informally but there could be more as a lot of the social events are in the evening

pros: Great management and support for skills development.
cons: Career progression not possible. Employees are seen just as a business decision from the perspective of upper management are thus easily replaceable.

pros: You could choose the events you wanted to do, zero hour contract. Quite casual job, involved setting up the open days and conducting campus tours
cons: Student outreach roles are fun, there isn't actually a downside that I can think of!

pros: Very friendly group of individuals
cons: Slow moving days at times however friendly colleagues helpful

job_title: Senior Lecturer In Marketing in Gloucester, England
pros: close to my home, and good environment but only now after the change of senior management, as before it was a very toxic environment.
cons: lower payment, difficult to be promoted because there is not enough budget, and it is a very small team so we end up teaching several subjects

review_title: Agile new university but like most of HE financially challenged

pros: Pension, annual leave, colleagues, students, sustainability commitment

pros: great team and very supportive manager

pros: Excellent job for a current UOG student who loves their course and the University. Great opportunity to develop confidence and leadership skills.
cons: Not many cons I can think of!

pros: Holiday Pension Team ethos Working environment
cons: Have to pay for parking Unions create toxic working environment

pros: A supportive team and colleagues make it a great place to work.

pros: Friendly and professional working environment

pros: Great team to work for. Very supportive and lively atmosphere
cons: There can be quite a bit of travel between the campuses due to there being 3 educational campuses and the main office

job_title: Head of Department in Gloucester, England
pros: Accessible, Friendly, flexible, interesting, local
cons: small, limited progression, not diverse, expensive, male dominated

pros: Great colleagues, great benefits package, strong focus on future growth.
cons: Management do not value their staff, too bureaucratic, unions do not represent their members properly and instead act as a huge barrier to positive change. Poor performance is not managed.

pros: Good community. Nice campus sites.
cons: Management communication could be improved.

pros:
Very open to part-time contracts and job shares
Genuinely cares about the students
Plenty of training available on request
In general, colleagues are well-meaning and work together
cons:
Bureaucracy (that plagues all universities)
Semi-regular shuffles that demotivate staff and lose great staff
Whilst some top-level staff are great, others are totally out of touch with their colleagues on the front lines

pros:
For a University, pay grades are below average, but still better than other areas. Park Campus is beautiful, but others need some real work.  

Some work colleagues turn to friends, but are so stressed watching their own backs will never help you. This I cannot blame them for.

Job Opportunities do crop up from time to time. I have moved within the organisation 3 times, with the first being an poor experience, second good and thirdly an awful experience that brought stress and anxiety home with me. Though the Job Opportunities are available, you have to question why so many people are leaving. The company is not expanding, it is minimising. So why are job openings always being advertised?
cons:
Line Managers who rarely actually guide you in your role, even when asking for opinions or help. Asking for help is often ignored on a daily basis. An expectation of 'always on call' which grew to the point of resignation. The blasé attitude I received when handing over my resignation made me feel like I had wasted my time and was ready to be replaced tomorrow. 

HR will message your Line Manager with a response rather than you, even if you asked a question. This has happened even when I have asked for assistance from with being bullied day in day out, where I wanted the issue to be kept confidential with HR. By 5pm the next day, the entirety of Park Campus knew. 

A constant bullying atmosphere, similar to other reviews where staff are hopelessly crawling over each other to get a management position, whilst simultaneously stabbing colleagues in the back. No confidence in your position due to constant restructuring and movement of staff. 

After walking past the new Pittville site after resigning, it looks like an accident waiting to happen. 

Staff from external companies often work harder than many Managers. It is disgraceful that some external staff are paid significantly less for a much harder job. Stop privatising services and pay the staff who work for the University a true and well deserved salary.

review_title: Needs a new direction and inspiration
job_title: Professor Service Manager in Gloucester, England
pros: Great holiday, good pension, good location
cons:
Poor leadership by executive team
No real strategy 
Poor care by most senior directors for staff 
Drive staff too hard with lots of burnout risk

pros:
Colleagues that are (almost) always available for advice.

Gorgeous campuses (especially Francis Close Hall).

Motivated students.
cons:
Stifling bureaucracy (as with most uni’s).

Little collaboration across departments—could be the distance between campuses.

Understaffed.
